1.text: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.

2.text: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?

3.text: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.

4.text: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.

5.text: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)

6.text: To dwell in the clifts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.

7.text: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

8.text: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.

9.text: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.

10.text: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.

11.text: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.

12.text: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.

13.text: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.

14.text: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.

15.text: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.

16.text: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

17.text: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.

18.text: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

19.text: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

20.text: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.

21.text: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.

22.text: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.

23.text: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.

24.text: Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.

25.text: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?

26.text: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

27.text: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.

28.text: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.

29.text: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.

30.text: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.

31.text: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
